intro: Christolea parryoides, commonly known as the Parry's Christolea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. It is often found in desert regions of Nevada, Utah, and Arizona. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
